post.author: DoV_Tomas
post.body:
For a challenge I looked into this issue and I didn't have much luck cracking it.

It's been a long time since I've played the game but I assumed the sequence takes place in the cafeteria in the very first map of the game. I opened the Marscity map and examined the Turkey Puncher entity (model and gui) and there was nothing connected to the model - ie no triggers, relay, sendemail entity, etc.

I next looked into the gui coding and again nothing indicating a trigger. I even went as far as looking into def files, the map script, and other possible places the code may reside. I did find the actual email that is sent but nothing that sends it. I also did a forum search and again I found no information on how the message is sent.

Of course I'm no expert but thus far I've usually been able track things down using the methods I described above. I really wonder since it's an easter egg whether it's hard coded somewhere. In time I'll likely find it but for now it's got me stumped. Sorry couldn't help dude.

The only fast solution I would suggest is to add some code to the TP gui to make it send a trigger at say an arbitrary score (for example something less than 30k). Actually that would probably be easier than finding how id did it.

post.author: DoV_Tomas
post.body:
Well first off IMO a puzzle that's sure to take a player a few minutes to solve may not be a good idea in a MP map, given the pace and frenetic nature of arena style MP maps.

My memory of the editor is a bit faded, but I don't recall any ready-made entity that can sense the score of the TP game. I can't really even think of a way to do it with triggers if in fact the game's score is what you want to activate an action.

Honestly re-working the script is really the only right way to do it. If you're not a coder well it's about time you learn a little since coding really does unlock a lot of powerful options. You don't even really have to write the code, just cut and paste. Maybe for now leave it and work on other stuff in your map and play a bit with scripting. Likely you'll find the solution in time. That's how I learned and that's how a lot of people learned also. If I had the time I would look into it for you, put working two jobs really doesn't leave a whole lot at the end of the day.

GL
